text: Hi all, is it possible to have a blog post editing experience allowing the editor to choose modular blocks to be inserted in the post body using a drag an drop experience like the one for pages?
Not yet, but it’s something we’re working on! Would you be interested in trying it out when we go to beta?
If so, feel free to DM me your email and portal ID
Great thanks. Can't wait to have that same great experience for the blog area

Design Manager has a column system, it’s applying Bootstrap 2 styles (spanX).  There’s also some default breakpoint at 768.  How do I disable that 768 breakpoint so that we can use more responsive column classes instead?
you'd have to override it, I don't think you can edit the default css items.,..

if you’re using the <https://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/building-blocks/themes/HubSpot-cms-boilerplate|cms theme boilerplate> and <https://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/templates/drag-and-drop-areas|dnd_area>, you have control over the CSS styles and can change the breakpoints as you see fit
<https://github.com/HubSpot/cms-theme-boilerplate/blob/master/src/css/layout.css#L354>
<https://github.com/HubSpot/cms-theme-boilerplate/blob/master/src/css/layout.css#L120>

If you are using <https://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/building-blocks/templates/drag-and-drop-templates|Design Manager Drag and Drop templates>. As <@U25PYL3Q8> said, you’ll need to override the styles.

Thanks, I’ll start looking into the new boilerplate and dnd_area, we’re starting from scratch and trying to figure out the best approach for both authoring content in HubSpot as well as integrating with our existing website
Themes and dnd_areas provide the best authoring experience for content creators. On the development side since they are code focused they give developers more control
<@UD53A9UUR> thank you for your response and for understanding my question! I will work on implementing this...
